result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan Anthony Willoughby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Obstructing Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evan Anthony Willoughby

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Evan Anthony Willoughby.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Evan Anthony Willoughby not in Court. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to 22TR190 with a fine of 987.50, 8 month license revocation, 12 month IID and AODA assessment. For 22CM40, amended to county ordinance Resisting/Obstructing with fine of $200 inclusive. In 22TR185, refusal to be reasonable. Attorney Cockerham pleads no contest to 22CM40 and 22TR190 on behalf of defendant. 

Court orders for 22CM40, amended to county ordinance Resisting/Obstructing with fine of $200 inclusive. For 22TR190, a fine of 987.50, 8 month license revocation, 12 month IID and AODA assessment. 22TR185, refusal is reasonable.

Att Cockerham- unresolved.

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of alcohol, No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license, no entering establishments whose primary purpose is serving alcohol with the exception of Drifters Bar

01:49 PM Defendant Evan Anthony Willoughby in court and not in-custody with attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, enters pleas of not guilty. Court accepts plea of not guilty and will set the matter for Status Conference with Judge Glonek. If there are any pending dates previously set with the trailing citations, the Court will move those dates to follow whatever dates we choose here. States request on bail: $350 signature bond wtih conditions of No use or possession of alcohol, No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license, no entering establishments whose primary purpose is serving alcohol with the exception of Drifters Bar as defendant does work there and part owner but may not consume any alcohol. 
Atty Wyshnytzky does indicate that defendant does manage a bar out in Foxboro. Defendant does have certain job duties such as purchasing alcohol, doing inventory, selling alcohol to customers and making alcoholic beverages for customers. He will not be consuming alcoholic drinks but we would be asking for him to continue with his job duties as previously outlined. Defendant is also a local resident and has lived here entire life and as does his entire family. Defendant does not have any serious criminal matters. Atty indicates defendant does have about $100 he can post here today, but would request the State's request of a signature bond. 
Court will order $1000 signature bond with conditions of No use or possession of alcohol, No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license, no entering establishments whose primary purpose is serving alcohol with the exception of Drifters Bar as defendant does work there but may not consume alcohol. Court offers defendant text message reminder slip. State indicates this a breath refusal.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
